name: Cabinet for Health and Family Services Secretary's Office
description: The Cabinet for Health and Family Services Secretary's Office is the executive office responsible for overseeing Kentucky's health and family services programs. The cabinet's mission is to be a diverse and inclusive organization providing programs, services and support that protect and promote the health and well-being of all Kentuckians and their communities. The office oversees various departments including social services, public health, health coverage and resources, family services, and licensing and certification. The cabinet serves as the central coordinating body for health and human services across the Commonwealth of Kentucky.
source: Verified from official Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services website
notes: Current Secretary: Steven Stack, MD. Direct phone: (502) 564-7042. Fax: (502) 564-7091. The cabinet oversees multiple agencies and programs including child protection, adult protection, foster care, adoption, public health, Medicaid, and various licensing and certification programs.
